articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian Great King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian Great King

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Cambodian Great King Norodom Sihanouk on his 89th birthday.
					
					 The message sincerely wished the great king good health and happiness, saying he is being respected as the closest friend of the Korean people as he not only has devoted his whole life to the independence of Cambodia and the prosperity of the Khmer nation but made great contributions to boosting the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Message of Sympathy to Cambodian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Message of Sympathy to Cambodian PM

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of sympathy to his Cambodian counterpart Hun Sen on Sunday as regards the flood that hit Cambodia, causing big human and material losses.
					
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation with the government and people of the Kingdom of Cambodia, hoping that they would eradicate the aftermath of natural disaster at an early date and bring the people in the afflicted areas back to normal.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Learns about Co-op Farms
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Learns about Co-op Farms

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim learned about farming at cooperative farms in South Hwanghae Province on Friday and Saturday on the spot.
					
					 Going round several farms including the Jangguk Cooperative Farm in Jaeryong County and the Muhak Cooperative Farm in Sinwon County, he learned about the immediate farming including harvesting and thrashing.
					
					 He underscored importance of the tasks facing the province in implementing the plan of the Workers' Party of Korea to bring about a decisive turn in improving the standard of people's living by settling the food issue of the people without fail.
					
					 He discussed the issues to rapidly conclude this year's farming and speed up the preparations for new year's farming and took measures.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea headed by Masatake Shinzato, chief of Okinawa Prefecture of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism, and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Sunday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They bowed to the President in humble reverence, calling back his immortal contributions to global independence.
					
					 They made an entry in the visitors' book.

articles.title: European Parliamentary Delegation Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
European Parliamentary Delegation Tours Mangyongdae

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The delegation for the Relations with Korean Peninsula of the European Parliament headed by Chairman Christian Ehler visited the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae on Sunday.
					
					 Bring briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of the President and his family members in Mangyongdae, the guests looked round with keen interest the historic relics preserved with care.
					
					 They had a photo taken to memorize their visit to the old home.
					
					 On the same day they visited the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory.

articles.title: Vocal Recital of People's Artiste Son Tae Won Held
articles.content:
Vocal Recital of People's Artiste Son Tae Won Held

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- A vocal recital of People's Artiste Son Tae Won was held at the Hamhung Grand Theatre from Oct. 28.
					
					 Appreciating the recital were officials, artistes and working people in South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 He earnestly sang songs "O, The Leader's Embrace" and "We Long for You, General" in boundless reverence for the peerlessly great persons who brought him up to be a singer well known to the country. 
					
					 Songs "We Sing of the Party" and "Yanji Bomb" were acclaimed as they showed the singer's unique and rich volume.
					
					 Put on the stage were such numbers as mixed duet "On This Blooming Spring Day" from revolutionary opera "The Fate of a Self-Defence Corps Man", male trio "The 2,000-ri Amnok River" and mixed chorus "Do Prosper, Era of the Workers' Party".  Son sang these songs together with his disciples.

articles.title: US and S. Korean Military Provocation Moves Flailed
articles.content:
US and S. Korean Military Provocation Moves Flailed

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Military bosses of the U.S. and south Korea held the 35th "military committee meeting" in Seoul on Oct. 27 at which they "examined joint defense posture" while talking about "north's military provocation". At the 43rd "annual security council meeting" on Friday they published a joint statement in which they agreed to complete the "joint plan for coping with local provocation", develop the "tailored deterrent strategy" and "intensify joint watch on the north", while groundlessly taking issue with the DPRK.
					
					 Minju Joson in a by-lined commentary Sunday terms the south Korea-U.S. "military committee meeting" and "annual security council meeting" criminal confabs to increase the danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We cannot but take a serious note of the fact that the U.S. and south Korean warmongers agreed to round up the "joint plan for coping with local provocation", talking about "north's local provocation", the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 According to a report, the plan envisages the south Korean puppet forces taking control of operations and the U.S. getting its forces in south Korea, Japan and the Pacific region involved in the operations to back south Korea in case armed conflict such as the Yonphyong Island case occurs between the north and the south. The U.S. and south Korean warmongers seek to fake up an armed conflict case and ignite an all-out war under its pretext.
					
					 They had so far held dozens of war confabs under the pretext of "security" but never before have they revealed their ambition for invasion of the DPRK as this time. What should not be overlooked is that the south Korean warmongers are staging war maneuvers against the DPRK, timed to coincide with these war confabs.
					
					 It is the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers who are committing military provocations on the Korean Peninsula. That's why the tension has not been defused and the danger of a war is increasing on the Korean Peninsula despite the DPRK's sincere efforts.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean warmongers had better stop rash act, clearly understanding who their rival is.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Chides Violation of Free Speech
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Chides Violation of Free Speech

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- "The path of the nation", organ of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), made public a statement on Oct. 26 in denunciation of the authorities' suppression of the freedom of speech.
					
					 The statement recalled: Choe Si Jung, chairperson of the Broadcasting and Communication Committee, forced the organization to delete off articles posted on its Internet website, on the alleged violation of the fascist law. He even threatened he would bring a charge against the organization.
					
					 The revelation of Choe's crimes already went public that he perpetrated all sorts of irregularities and corruption including speculation in real estate and accused innocent people on charges of violation of the fascist law, it pointed out.
					
					 This guy failed to deter the "Grand National Party" from conducting the campaign critical of the opponent candidate through its broadcasting and communications during the October 26 Seoul mayoral election, the statement noted, adding this has sparked off serious contention.
					
					 It charged that this guy dares gag the freedom of expression on the strength of the "National Security Law".

articles.title: S. Korean Religionists Stage Sit-in Strike against FTA
articles.content:
S. Korean Religionists Stage Sit-in Strike against FTA

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Religionists belonging to the Christian Committee for Joint Measures for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. FTA staged an action against the conclusion of the humiliating agreement with the U.S. at the puppet National Assembly on Oct. 27, south Korean CBS reported.
					
					 They staged a sit-in strike at the room of the floor leader of the Democratic Party, an opposition party.
					
					 They demanded DP not pass through the NA the "motion calling for the ratification of FTA".
					
					 Then they attempted to stage a sit-in strike at the room of the floor leader of the "Grand National Party".
					
					 They accused the GNP of trying to pass the motion though the FTA has serious issues.
					
					 They vowed to fight it out to check the conclusion of the FTA.

articles.title: S. Korea-US Confabs for War of Aggression Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korea-US Confabs for War of Aggression Flayed

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and public organizations including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Solidarity for Progress and the Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally on Oct. 28 to denounce the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet belligerent forces for their criminal confab for preparations for a war of aggression.
					
					 At the rally the organizations said that the military authorities of south Korea and the U.S. are working to hold an annual security council meeting in Seoul that day.
					
					 At the meeting the warmongers are set to discuss the issues related to setting up the missile committee and mending the missile guidelines between south Korea and the U.S. The U.S. also seeks to let south Korea bear the most of the funds for transferring the U.S. military base.
					
					 The organizations condemned the belligerent forces for frequently staging offensive exercises for invading the north and intensifying the military threat to it while working out even the war scenarios simulating an "contingency" in the DPRK. 
					
					 They stressed that all these acts should be stopped at once as they will increase the possibility of military conflicts in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 They strongly insisted on the abolition of the south Korea-U.S. alliance for aggression and the conclusion of a peace agreement in the peninsula.

articles.title: Chinese Media on Development of China-DPRK Relations
articles.content:
Chinese Media on Development of China-DPRK Relations

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Chinese newspaper People's Daily on October 24 carried an article titled "Let Us Carry forward Friendship and Boost Cooperation" by Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK relationship has steadily developed, weathering trials of changes in the international situation over the past 62 years since the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries, the writer of the article said, and went on:
					
					 Thanks to the efforts made by both sides in recent years successes have been made in multifaceted exchange and cooperation and the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations have reached a new phase of development.
					
					 There frequently took place mutual visits of high-level officials between the two countries in the field of politics.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited China four times since May last year to exchange views on the matters of bilateral relations and the issues of mutual concern with party and state leaders of China and reached important common understanding, thus indicating the orientation of developing the China-DPRK relations and breathing new life into them.
					
					 The two countries have conducted such brisk activities as cooperation, exchange and visit in various fields including economy and culture, increasing their successes as the days go by. They have also played positive roles for defending the regional peace and stability by getting in close touch with each other over regional and international issues.
					
					 The achievements in developing the China-DPRK relations would have been unthinkable without the special care and particular concern shown by the leaders of the two parties and two countries, the writer noted, adding:
					
					 Today the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations have entered a new phase of development.
					
					 We, together with the DPRK side, have willingness to exert efforts to develop the Sino-DPRK friendship by remaining committed to the important common understanding reached by the leaders of the two parties and two countries and continuing to boost the visits of high-ranking officials.
					
					 We also respect and support the active measures taken by the DPRK side to defend stability, develop economy and improve the standard of people's living.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people would surely register bigger successes in their cause of building a prosperous and powerful country under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Copies of the same article were posted on Internet homepages including networks of Xinhua, the government, the people, Huan Qiu, information service and radio.

articles.title: British Organizations Censures DPRK-Targeted Exercises
articles.content:
British Organizations Censures DPRK-Targeted Exercises

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy issued a joint statement on Oct. 24, denouncing the south Korean puppet army for its military exercises codenamed Hoguk.
					
					 The recent exercises in which huge war equipment is to be involved are very dangerous military maneuvers aggravating the situation of the Korean Peninsula as they are targeted against the DPRK, the statement said.
					
					 Necessary on the peninsula right now is detente and, to this end, the south Korean puppet forces should immediately halt stoking confrontation with the DPRK, the statement held.
					
					 The exercises may spark overall military conflicts and lead to a war as they are premeditated provocations to stifle Korean-style socialism by force of arms and remove the world anti-imperialist revolutionary forces, it stressed.
					
					 It noted that the British followers of the Juche idea and Songun idea strongly demand the south Korean puppet forces immediately halt the reckless military rehearsals.
					
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association also released a statement on Oct. 25 in denunciation of Hoguk exercises.

articles.title: White Paper on Socialist System of Laws Published in China
articles.content:
White Paper on Socialist System of Laws Published in China

					 Beijing, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Information Office of the State Council of China recently published a white paper on the Socialist System of Laws with Chinese Characteristics.
					
					 The white paper referred to the achievements made in China's development of socialist democracy and legal system and comprehensively and systematically introduced the course of the establishment of the socialist system of laws with Chinese characteristics and the legal system.

articles.title: Pullback of US Troops Demanded
articles.content:
Pullback of US Troops Demanded

					 Tehran, October 29 (KCNA) -- The chief of the Staff of the General Command of the Armed Forces of Iran on Wednesday strongly demanded pullback of the U.S. troops from the region.
					
					 The presence of foreign forces is the main factor which destroys the regional stability and brings about a plunder of wealth, he said, adding the Middle East countries demand the complete withdrawal of U.S. troops from the region.
					
					 He urged the U.S. to pull all its forces from not only Iraq and Afghanistan but the region.

articles.title: US Unemployment Serious
articles.content:
US Unemployment Serious

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The unemployment is still serious in the U.S. due to the continuous economic stagnation.
					
					 The U.S. Labor Department on Oct. 27 said the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 402,000 in the week ending Oct. 22.

articles.title: Companies' Profits Drop in Japan
articles.content:
Companies' Profits Drop in Japan

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Japanese companies are losing huge profits owing to the serious economic crisis.
					
					 JFE Holdings Inc. said Wednesday it logged a group net loss of 24.31 billion yen in the April-September first half of fiscal 2011.
					
					 Fujitsu and Nippon Steel lost their profits dropping 69.8 percent and 31.3 percent respectively at this period comparing with the last year.

articles.title: Japan's Industrial Production Falls
articles.content:
Japan's Industrial Production Falls

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Japan's industrial production fell 4 percent in September from a month earlier, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said in a report on Friday.

articles.title: Cote d'Ivoire Media Agency to Boost Reconciliation Process
articles.content:
Cote d'Ivoire Media Agency to Boost Reconciliation Process

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The government of Cote d'Ivoire is striving to enhance its media's role in the work to promote the national reconciliation.
					
					 A seminar was opened in its capital on Oct. 24 to discuss the role of media in the national reconciliation process and the development programs.
					
					 The participants unanimously stressed that it is particularly important to strengthen media organs and train journalists.

articles.title: Brazilian President Renews License of Free Economic Zone in Amazon
articles.content:
Brazilian President Renews License of Free Economic Zone in Amazon

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff signed on Monday a bill to renew the license of the Free Economic Zone of Manaus, the capital city of the Amazonas state, for another 50 years to boost the development of the Amazon Rainforest region.
					
					 The bill also foresees the expansion of the free economic zone.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Myanmar, Ghana
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Myanmar, Ghana

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Flood damage caused by heavy rains is expanding in several states of Myanmar.
					
					 The death toll increased 200 as of Oct. 26 and 2,100 families suffered from the flood in a state.
					
					 Heavy rains fell in the capital of Ghana recently, causing flood damage. The flood left 9 persons dead, dwelling houses destroyed and schools and shops closed. The electricity supply to residents was suspended.

articles.title: Crimes in Capitalist Countries
articles.content:
Crimes in Capitalist Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Eleven people were accused of fraud charges on Thursday in connection with a 1-billion-U.S.- dollar scheme to falsely claim disability benefits for retired New York commuter railway workers. 
					
					 The Kumamoto District Court sentenced a 40-year-old man to death Tuesday for killing two women and stealing money in separate incidents in Kumamoto Prefecture in 2004 and 2011.
					
					 Australian federal police on Thursday confirmed they have discovered 55kg of cocaine and methamphetamines in a shipment of beer from Mexico.

articles.title: Iran Blasts Double Standards of West
articles.content:
Iran Blasts Double Standards of West

					 Tehran, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Iranian deputy minister of Economy and Finance flayed the double standards of the Western countries when it comes to a human rights issue during a meeting with the chairman of Foreign Affairs Committee of the German Parliament.
					
					 He said that the West was using human rights to apply selective political pressure on countries.
					
					 While the West has focused on what they have alleged were human rights violations in Iran, it has kept mum on massive human rights breaches in Israel, he noted.
